name: Biosecurity Basics
description: Introduction to fundamental biosecurity principles and practices for livestock farms. Learn how to protect your animals from disease threats.

sections.title: What is Biosecurity?
sections.content: Biosecurity refers to measures taken to protect your farm from disease introduction and spread. It includes prevention, control, and containment strategies.

sections.title: Key Principles
sections.content: The three pillars of biosecurity are: 1) Prevention - stopping diseases from entering, 2) Control - managing spread within the farm, 3) Containment - preventing spread to other farms.

name: Disease Recognition
description: Learn to identify early signs and symptoms of common livestock diseases. Early detection is crucial for effective disease management.
objectives: Recognize clinical signs of major diseases
Know when to call a veterinarian

sections.title: Common Disease Symptoms
sections.content: Visual guide to identifying symptoms in poultry and pigs including respiratory distress, lethargy, reduced feed intake, and abnormal behavior.

sections.title: Disease Case Studies
sections.content: Real-world examples of disease outbreaks and how early recognition led to successful containment.

name: Vaccination Protocols
description: Master proper vaccination techniques and scheduling for optimal herd immunity. Protect your livestock through effective immunization programs.
objectives: Learn proper vaccine storage and handling

sections.title: Vaccine Types and Storage
sections.content: Overview of live, killed, and recombinant vaccines. Proper cold chain management and storage requirements.

sections.title: Administration Techniques
sections.content: Step-by-step guide to subcutaneous, intramuscular, and oral vaccine administration.

name: Hygiene and Sanitation
description: Implement effective cleaning and disinfection protocols to maintain a disease-free environment on your farm.

sections.title: Cleaning Fundamentals
sections.content: The 6-step cleaning process: dry cleaning, pre-soaking, washing, rinsing, drying, and disinfection.

sections.title: Disinfectant Selection Guide
sections.content: Comparison of quaternary ammonium, chlorine-based, iodine, and peroxygen disinfectants.

name: Visitor Management
description: Control farm access and manage visitors to minimize disease introduction risks. Learn best practices for visitor protocols.

sections.title: Visitor Risk Assessment
sections.content: Understanding disease risks from different visitor types and recent farm contact history.

sections.title: Access Control Procedures
sections.content: Setting up biosecurity zones, shower facilities, and protective clothing requirements.

name: Emergency Response
description: Prepare for and respond to disease outbreaks effectively. Learn emergency protocols and rapid response procedures.

sections.title: Outbreak Detection
sections.content: Recognizing outbreak patterns and triggering emergency protocols.

sections.title: Containment Strategies
sections.content: Quarantine procedures, movement restrictions, and depopulation protocols.

name: Record Keeping
description: Maintain accurate farm records for traceability and compliance. Essential for disease investigation and regulatory requirements.

sections.title: Essential Farm Records
sections.content: Animal movements, medication logs, vaccination records, visitor logs, and mortality records.

sections.title: Digital Record Systems
sections.content: Using Farm-Secure and other digital tools for efficient record management.

name: Feed Safety
description: Ensure feed quality and safety to prevent disease transmission through contaminated feed. Learn proper feed storage and handling.

sections.title: Feed-borne Disease Risks
sections.content: How diseases like African Swine Fever can spread through contaminated feed ingredients.

sections.title: Storage and Handling
sections.content: Proper feed storage, pest control, and contamination prevention measures.
